content: In the past github would add an underline below keywords such as "Fixes" and I could be sure that a PR would e.g. close once PR landed. Does it not do that any longer?
Or is there another way to check this now?
Look to the right, there's "Successfully merging this pull request may close these issues."

I recently noticed that, too. Coincidentally it was the first time I've edited a PR to add the "fixes" afterwards, and I drew the wrong conclusion that you can't edit it in successfully. I edited the thing multiple times and was fairly confused for a while until I figured it out. (You can see my cunfusion in the edit history of #87974.)
:laughing: I did the exact same thing. Why would they remove that?
